intro: Dracaena victoria, commonly known as the Victoria dracaena, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asparagaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that appear in clusters at the tips of the stems. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires moderate sunlight, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Dracaena victoria is also valued for its air-purifying properties and ability to thrive in low-light conditions.
